author: Randall Huskinson
content:
Popular purveyor of an Indian food/curry combo plate known in Manchester as “rice and three.”

This & That is a safe bet for an affordable, filling, reasonably tasty meal, although across many visits I’ve come to notice that the flavor profiles don’t vary that much between the dishes, especially if they are the same colour. And they tend to be overly spicy, leaning on peppers for flavor more the. The subtlety of other Indian spices. After a couple of visits I’ve noticed that the ratio of rice to curry is, well, mostly rice, which of course is filling. I no longer get rice and three, in order the curries stand alone in individual containers and take it home. Sometimes I get a samosa as well.

It can be heaving with customers, especially on game days. The space is small but clean and well lit, with plenty of shared table space. The location is NOT on a main street, rather feels like it’s an alley, which adds a bit of charm like hive found a secret spot.
